result.execSummary:
The defendant Richard A Kochevar was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Criminal Damage to Property [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse, Domestic Abuse Assessments], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.01(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: The Court orders that if the defendant fails to pay the fine and costs within 60 days of the date of conviction or if the Court has authorized monthly payments for the fine and costs and they have not been paid, the Court will enter a judgment and all available enforcement actions may be used to collect this debt.  You must keep the Clerk of Circuit Court informed of your current address until the debt is paid in full.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Richard A Kochevar

defendant.name: Kochevar, Richard A
defendant.address: W5335 Broken Arrow Road, Sheldon, WI 54766

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: Reimbursement letter mailed to Richard Kochevar
Claim for Legal Services - Attorney Terry Nussberger paid $264.00 for court appointed attorney fees
DE has indicated does not intend to seek PCR

Defendant Richard A Kochevar in court with attorney Terry L. Nussberger.  James Babbbitt appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Agreement has been reached in this matter.  State recites case settlement into the court record.  Court instructs on plea questionnaire/waiver of rights.  DE will enter a plea of G, court will accept and find the DE guilty.  Court accepts the recommendations of the parties,  DE will pay a fine of $10.00/CC/DNA surcharge/DOM surcharge. DE will set up a PP with the COCC office.

records.descr: Pet for appointment counsel,affidavit of indigency

records.addlTxt: Paperwork filed by Paulette Kochevar completed with TO Shelter removing no contacts from the bond.
No contact with Paulette Kochevar.  If victim completes the TO shelter program and returns the papers the no contact will be removed from the bond.

Defendant Richard A Kochevar in court.  James D Babbitt appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  State moves to quash warrant.  Warrant quashed.  DE has applied for court appointed counsel.  Court will appoint counsel, will repay at the rate of $100.00 per month commencing 2-01-16.  Court will appoint Atty Nussberger.  DE will enter a plea of NG.  State requests a $1000.00 sign bond with no contact with Paulette Kochevar.  Court will order as such, victim may go to the TO Shelter and complete the program, if returned the no contact will be removed from the bond.  VWC will contact victim as to this requirement.  Set for RH 1-19-16 @ 11:00AM.
Letter from PD office that DE does not qualify for PD services.
Filed by the District Attorney's office
Defendant Richard A Kochevar not in court.  James Jay Rennicke appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court will authorize a probable cause warrant, $500.00 cash, WI only.  State files a COS.
